title: localhost ‚Äì Tech Community Meetup
description:
localhost is a group of tech enthusiasts and software developers working to strengthen the software developer community in Iceland.
While many great communities exist, they often feel fragmented. Our goal is to bring people together, collaborate more, and create shared spaces to connect. As a first step, we‚Äôve launched a shared Discord server ‚Äî and this event is the next step.
üëâ Join the localhost Discord: [https://discord.gg/WXKpuH4v9B](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fdiscord.gg%2FWXKpuH4v9B%3Ffbclid%3DIwZXh0bgNhZW0CMTAAYnJpZBExalVwSWM5WWhkTkF4SnEwM3NydGMGYXBwX2lkEDIyMjAzOTE3ODgyMDA4OTIAAR4oYURttzaQLyqFD_g70BSDEjIJW_GxvKumh8uaSu7EbUvEMhL945KX_hLD0Q_aem_jBtLr5qa2uFgYUlxUOs8Bw&h=AT3Qk-4cx25ReIqek8GGvnjl_XVf672-t40-_ntyQd0jLjMnM2CCaI9yoYnbjbrk44FkanJFF3ktbkGQCp9BjWWLEWjARRvMSqwdhAbfv6-XfsaxplVms447PBb1wyxNsc3yS_nd1T-AgbKLIQ4&__tn__=q&c[0]=AT1TlLqp2IgKGEsEBxMQvGQR4mhytWMYWgirxfLXezeeczObm0SQgPNEEU9haDaxStJnt2mfMPz_o_DaeEnUcLttXdhuIdTpxc2dKZfQGDzRTJyE8vkQ8MH5zAaRA_iT)
Join us for an evening of short talks and community.
‚∏ª
üïó Agenda (GMT)
20:00 ‚Äì Welcome & intro from hosts
20:10 ‚Äì First talk
20:30 ‚Äì Second talk
20:50 ‚Äì Third talk (TBA)
21:00 ‚Äì Thanks and follow-ups!
‚∏ª
üé§ First Talk (20:10)
Alex Couper
Software developer / creator of [naglasupan.is](http://naglasupan.is/?fbclid=IwZXh0bgNhZW0CMTAAYnJpZBExalVwSWM5WWhkTkF4SnEwM3NydGMGYXBwX2lkEDIyMjAzOTE3ODgyMDA4OTIAAR46RICXNosh5YvWXGf7N7MNLrjuqIZrfSu-o-yQWc6wcIc6JRlnLz_-fMVP7A_aem_PmTYSvXcslAGiIbr2emQdw)
Side-projects in 2026
- Why we make them
- Why we fail to do anything with most of them, and why that‚Äôs ok
Why we need them, and a community around them, now more than ever.
‚∏ª
üé§ Second Talk (20:30)
Kristj√°n Oddsson
Software developer with professional experience building on and around open source.
Introduction to open-source
An introduction to open source that challenges the common view of it as "free software built by someone else".
This talk reframes open source as "our software" ‚Äî a shared, collaborative asset that we all have responsibility for, especially when we rely on it professionally. Instead of treating projects as external products where you file an issue and wait for maintainers to act, we‚Äôll explore a mindset where using open source makes you part of the project: you fix the bugs you hit, add the features you need, and feed improvements back into the commons.
Drawing on experience with both Icelandic and international open source projects, we‚Äôll look at how healthy communities operate in practice, including examples like Homebrew‚Äôs funded contributor model and in‚Äëperson meetups. Attendees will leave with a clearer mental model of what open source really is, what it expects of us, and how to participate in a way that‚Äôs fair, sustainable, and beneficial to everyone using the software.
‚∏ª
We‚Äôll announce the remaining talks soon and update this event as they‚Äôre confirmed.

title: Afternoon on Internet Security
description:
Join us for an afternoon of exploring different aspects of Internet security! National and international experts from various sectors will gather to share their insights from a wide range of Internet security-related topics. We envisage an afternoon full of information-sharing, lively discussions and networking opportunities for the Icelandic Internet community.
The event will end with a small reception for all participants at the Beer Garden, Fosshotel Reykjavik (√û√≥runnart√∫n 1).
**_This is an in-person event only!_**
Many thanks to ISNIC for hosting the event!

title: Open conversation about humane technology
description:
Do you wish apps, the internet and technology in general were more helpful than harmful?
Join this open conversation where people come together to share their own experiences of digital life. We will explore what causes anxiety, fatigue or insecurity in our use of technology, and how we imagine a better digital future.
- What are people struggling with in their digital lives?
- What invisible processes might be influencing them?
- What would make a digital future better, fairer and/or more humane?
The discussion sets the foundation for an exhibition and workshop at the Future Festival 2026, where library visitors can, through conversation and play, explore how digital systems work and consider what kind of digital future they want to see.
The event will be hosted by Atli √û√≥r J√≥hannsson and Halld√≥ra Mogensen from the Icelandic Association for Humane technology.
No registration needed. Coffee and snacks will be provided.
The event will be on the 5th floor of Gr√≥fin City Library.
For more information, contact: info@mannvaen.is
